option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/Domagoj/source/repos/DailyAdventureChallenge_MobileApp/DailyAdventureChallenge":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/ui/theme/Type.kt\":\"This file defines the typography styles for a Jetpack Compose-based Android application. It sets the default text style for the `bodyLarge` component, and provides commented-out examples for other text styles such as `titleLarge` and `labelSmall`.\\n\\n`Typography`: Defines the set of Material typography styles to be used in the application.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file for an Android project, where configuration options common to all sub-projects/modules can be added.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it sets up the build environment by applying the `com.android.application` and `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` plugins with specific versions.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and checks the context of the app under test.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the package name of the app under test matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. The file does not define any classes or functions, but rather contains a single unit test that verifies the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test case to verify the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 results in 4, which is the expected outcome.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android SDK version, dependencies, and Kotlin compiler settings. It also configures the build types and packaging options for the application. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the build settings for the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file appears to be the main activity of an Android application built using Jetpack Compose, a modern UI toolkit for Android.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: This is the main activity of the application, which sets up the Compose-based UI and displays a greeting message.\\n\\n`Greeting`: This is a Composable function that displays a greeting message with the provided name.\\n\\n`GreetingPreview`: This is a Composable function that provides a preview of the `Greeting` function within the application\\u0027s theme.\\n\\nThe file sets up the main activity of the application, which uses Jetpack Compose to display a simple greeting message. The `Greeting` function is the main UI component, and the `GreetingPreview` function allows for a preview of this component within the application\\u0027s theme.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/ui/theme/Theme.kt\":\"This file defines the theme for the \\\"Daily Adventure Challenge\\\" Android app using Jetpack Compose.\\n\\n`DarkColorScheme`: Defines the dark color scheme for the app.\\n\\n`LightColorScheme`: Defines the light color scheme for the app.\\n\\n`DailyAdventureChallengeTheme`: A composable function that sets up the theme for the app, including handling dynamic color support on Android 12 and above, and applying the appropriate color scheme based on the system\\u0027s dark mode setting.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/dailyadventurechallenge/ui/theme/Color.kt\":\"This file defines the color palette for the Daily Adventure Challenge app using Compose UI. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a set of color values that can be used throughout the app\\u0027s UI.\\n\\n`Purple80`: A dark purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey80`: A dark purple-grey color.\\n`Pink80`: A dark pink color.\\n`Purple40`: A lighter purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey40`: A lighter purple-grey color.\\n`Pink40`: A lighter pink color.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a Gradle configuration file that sets up the project structure and dependency management for the \\\"DailyAdventureChallenge\\\" Android application.\\n\\nThe `pluginManagement` block specifies the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\nThe `dependencyResolutionManagement` block sets the repositories to be used for resolving dependencies, including Google and Maven Central. It also sets the `RepositoriesMode` to `FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS`, which means that the build will fail if any project-specific repositories are defined.\\n\\nThe `rootProject.name` line sets the name of the root project to \\\"DailyAdventureChallenge\\\".\\n\\nThe `include(\\\":app\\\")` line includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\"}"}
